findings: Successfully converted complex market research survey with 3 distinct branching paths
Preserved all conditional routing: users branch based on product-usage answer (regularly/occasionally -> satisfaction, aware -> why-not-tried, never -> product-explanation)
All paths converge at price-importance node, demonstrating proper flow merge handling
Converted 10 nodes total: 1 start, 8 questions, 1 message, 1 end
Question types mapped: Ch (choice/yesNo), Rt (rating), Mc (multiChoice), Sl (slider), Tx (text)
Used ?in [regularly, occasionally] condition for combining multiple equals conditions into single conditional branch
Preserved all question descriptions, option labels with value mappings (e.g., regularly:"Yes regularly")
Slider configuration preserved with full parameters: min, max, step, showValue
Required field markers (*) correctly applied to 6 of 8 questions
Inline comments preserved to mark branching sections and flow structure
Multi-choice question (features-used) has 6 options all preserved
Message node (product-explanation) includes full explanatory content before question
Compression ratio of 2.82x demonstrates significant reduction while maintaining full survey logic
